item.title: Meet circle of fifths on music, through an analog clock
item.description: In my youth I studied classical guitar. I read a lot of sheet music and knew how to use key signatures. But I’ve never been able to identify, at a glance, the major or minor scale pair that defines a, non-trivial, signature. I thought this ability belonged only to very experienced musicians. A few days ago, I realized that I was completely wrong. Identifying the pair of scales that defines a key signature is as easy as using a wristwatch.
